body_html:
Could you try taking a look on theses instructions to compile with CMake?
When you're configuring TensorFlow you will choose if your binary will support GPU or not, however, you can't incorporate CUDA or cuDNN into the binary AFAIK.
Each user who installs TF with that compiled binary needs to have CUDA and cuDNN installed.

Disclaimer: it's been awhile since those docs were updated so probably some stuff, as some of the current limitations and cuDNN version for instance, could be ignored as a lot has changed since then. In case of the cuDNN you can use v6.1. All you need to compile though is present on it.

body:
Could you try taking a look on [theses instructions](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/README.md) to compile with CMake?
When you're configuring TensorFlow you will choose if your binary will support GPU or not, however, you can't incorporate CUDA or cuDNN into the binary AFAIK.
Each user who installs TF with that compiled binary needs to have CUDA and cuDNN installed.

Disclaimer: it's been awhile since those docs were updated so probably some stuff, as some of the current limitations and cuDNN version for instance, could be ignored as a lot has changed since then. In case of the cuDNN you can use v6.1. All you need to compile though is present on it.
